page.title: 01CWMBACH AND BUILTH ROAD
page.content: This area is almost totally farmland, grazing for sheep and cattle, The only industries are small and based at Builth Road where once there was an important railway junction. The old terraced railway cottages and even the station are now attractive modernised dwellings. At Cwmbach Llechrhyd, a mile or two away, is the Victorian Church of St. John's and the Victorian Pencerrig Primary School. The River Wye is a dominant feature of this area, flowing through one of the most beautiful, unspoilt valleys in Britain. So tourism and catering for the holiday trade form an important part of the economy of the area. But agriculture is by far the greatest source of employment for men. Local industries are related to the land and its management. Many people work in Builth and Llandrindod Wells.
